value.title: Store and Access NoSQL Data with Azure Cosmos DB and the Table API
value.excerpt: By using the Azure Cosmos DB Table API, you will benefit from the low latency, high availability, and scalability of Azure Cosmos DB in a Table storage application.

value.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
value.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and context.

value.title: Train and package an Azure machine learning module for deployment to IoT Edge device
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Declare and instantiate classes in TypeScript
value.excerpt: Learn how to declare and instantiate classes in TypeScript.

value.title: How to create an Azure SQL database | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, you will learn how to create an Azure SQL Database in the Azure Portal and how you can be more productive in Azure.    Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/p7X8lH_XMtI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Streaming Analytics
value.excerpt: In this learning path, discover Azure Stream Analytics streaming data, the concepts of event processing, and integration of Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

topItems.title: Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore how Azure Stream Analytics integrates with your applications or Internet of Things devices to gain insights with real-time streaming data.

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use Azure Event Hubs to reliably process high-volume data streams to enable you to code applications to send and receive messages through the hub.

topItems.title: Ingest data streams with Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure Stream Analytics jobs to process input data, transform it with a query, and return results.

value.title: Java on Azure
value.excerpt: Start here and learn how you can build, migrate and scale Java applications on Azure leveraging Azure services, and using tools and frameworks that you know and love – Spring, Tomcat, WildFly, JBoss, WebLogic, WebSphere, Maven, Gradle, IntelliJ, Eclipse, Jenkins, Terraform etc.

topItems.title: Introduction to Java on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Goal of this module is to welcome you as Java Developers on Azure. In this module, you'll begin to discover the opportunities for Java developers on Azure.

topItems.title: Choose an Azure service for deploying your Java application
topItems.excerpt: In this tutorial, you'll learn about running your Java applications on Azure, and choose the best option between Virtual Machines, Azure App Services, Serverless functions, Kubernetes and Azure Spring Cloud.

topItems.title: Create and deploy a data-driven Spring Boot Java application to Azure App Service with Spring Initializr and Maven
topItems.excerpt: Create a Spring Boot application, connect it to a MySQL database and then deploy to Azure App Service.

topItems.title: Deploy a Java web app to Azure
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn how to create a Java web application and deploy it to Azure App Service.

value.title: Virtualization - Sharing cloud resources
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Dive deeper into how the cloud works by understanding virtualization. How are computing power, memory, input and output, networking, and storage virtualized?

topItems.title: Share cloud resources
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Get an introduction to virtualization, one of the many technologies that power the cloud. Learn what virtualization is, its benefits, and how cloud resources are shared.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Virtualize computing power
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about how computing power is virtualized using virtual CPUs. Covers different types of CPU virtualization.

topItems.title: Virtualize memory
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how memory is virtualized to support cloud resources. Covers different types of memory mapping and related issues.

value.title: Build an Azure Digital Twins graph for a chocolate factory production line
value.excerpt: This module covers the first steps in building an Azure Digital Twins solution. The units cover making an instance of Azure Digital Twins, and learning about, creating, and visualizing, DTDL models. You will create, validate, graph, and query, models for a chocolate factory production line.

value.title: Choose a compute provisioning solution for your application
value.excerpt: Discover the services and tools available to automate the deployment and configuration of your Azure infrastructure.

value.title: Communicate effectively on GitHub by using Markdown
value.excerpt: Learn to use Markdown to communicate with brevity, clarity, and expression.

value.title: Create an enrichment pipeline with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Use the power of artificial intelligence to enrich your data and find new insights.

value.title: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles
value.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles

value.title: Automate development tasks by using GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Create a basic GitHub Action and use that action in a workflow.

value.excerpt: Learn how to build machine learning models with PyTorch

value.excerpt: Learn how to manage changes to your repository source by using pull requests.

value.title: Run a background task in an App Service Web App with WebJobs
value.excerpt: In this module, we'll guide you through creating a WebJob in the same project as an existing Web App and automating tasks with WebJobs.

value.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

value.title: Accelerate cloud adoption with the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
value.excerpt: Do you need a clear path forward for your cloud journey? This learning path includes best practice guidance to help you create a cloud strategy, define a cloud adoption plan, prepare your cloud environment with proper governance, and implement cloud operations in alignment with your organizational needs.  Cloud architects and IT professionals will learn and engage with the proven best practices, tools, and documentation in the Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure to build the technical knowledge needed to help your organization successfully adopt the cloud and meet business goals.

topItems.title: Getting started with the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
topItems.excerpt: CAF getting started. Use the Cloud Adoption Framework getting started guides to unblock your organization’s cloud adoption efforts

topItems.title: Prepare for successful cloud adoption with a well-defined strategy
topItems.excerpt: Success in cloud adoption is predicated by a clear strategy that helps the team understand executive direction and regularly measure progress. This module will help capture the cloud adoption strategy needed to drive your success.

topItems.title: CAF Plan: Prepare for cloud adoption with a data-driven plan.
topItems.excerpt: Prepare for cloud adoption with a data driven, cloud adoption plan from CAF. For new innovations, learn from others who have used the target platforms. For migrations, understand how to evaluate your assets and plan the efforts required to move them to the cloud.

topItems.title: Choose the best Azure landing zone to support your cloud operations requirements
topItems.excerpt: Azure landing zones help accelerate configuration of your environment to meet your operational requirements.

value.title: Capture feedback and monitoring data to continuously improve your software
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Recommend and design system feedback mechanisms
topItems.excerpt: Learn how surveys and application analytics create a feedback loop that helps you understand the voice of the customer.

topItems.title: Route system feedback to development teams
topItems.excerpt: Learn how continuous monitoring and dashboards give you insight into how customers use your software and where patterns of failure occur.

topItems.title: Manage site reliability
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

value.title: Optimize query performance in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Analyze individual query performance and determine where improvements can be made. Explore performance-related Dynamic Management Objects. Investigate how indexes and database design affect queries.

topItems.title: Describe SQL Server query plans
topItems.excerpt: Read and understand various forms of execution plans. Compare estimated vs actual plans. Learn how and why plans are generated.

topItems.title: Evaluate performance improvements
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

topItems.title: Explore performance-based design
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.
